de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.database.ids.distance

Interface KNNHeap<D extends Distance<D>>

  • Type Parameters:
    D - Distance function
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DoubleDistanceKNNHeap
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractKNNHeap, DistanceDBIDPairKNNHeap, DoubleDistanceDBIDPairKNNHeap, DoubleDistanceIntegerDBIDKNNHeap, DoubleDistanceIntegerDBIDKNNListHeap

    public interface KNNHeap<D extends Distance<D>>
    Interface for kNN heaps. To instantiate, use: DBIDUtil.newHeap(D, int)!

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(D distance, DBIDRef id)
      Add a distance-id pair to the heap unless the distance is too large.
      void clear()
      Clear the heap.
      int getK()
      Get the K parameter ("maxsize" internally).
      D getKNNDistance()
      Get the distance to the k nearest neighbor, or maxdist otherwise.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Test if the heap is empty.
      DistanceDBIDPair<D> peek()
      Peek at the largest element in the heap.
      DistanceDBIDPair<D> poll()
      Poll the largest element from the heap.
      int size()
      Current size of heap.
      KNNList<D> toKNNList()
      Serialize to a KNNList.

    • Method Detail

      • toKNNList

        KNNList<D> toKNNList()
        Serialize to a KNNList. This empties the heap!
        Returns:
        KNNList with the heaps contents.

      • getK

        int getK()
        Get the K parameter ("maxsize" internally).
        Returns:
        K

      • getKNNDistance

        D getKNNDistance()
        Get the distance to the k nearest neighbor, or maxdist otherwise.
        Returns:
        Maximum distance

      • add

        void add(D distance,
       DBIDRef id)
        Add a distance-id pair to the heap unless the distance is too large. Compared to the super.add() method, this often saves the pair construction.
        Parameters:
        distance - Distance value
        id - ID number

      • size

        int size()
        Current size of heap.
        Returns:
        Heap size

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Test if the heap is empty.
        Returns:
        true when empty.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clear the heap.

      • poll

        DistanceDBIDPair<D> poll()
        Poll the largest element from the heap. This is in descending order because of the heap structure. For a convenient way to serialize the heap into a list that you can iterate in ascending order, see toKNNList().
        Returns:
        largest element

      • peek

        DistanceDBIDPair<D> peek()
        Peek at the largest element in the heap.
        Returns:
        The current largest element.
